qas.question: At what global company was the first visible-spectrum LED developed?
What GE employee developed the visible-spectrum LED?
What color is associated with the visible-spectrum LED?
What color LED was later created in 1972?
What graduate student of Holonyak created the yellow LED?
At what global company was the first non-visible-spectrum LED developed?
What GE employee developed the non-visible-spectrum LED?
What color is associated with the non-visible-spectrum LED?
What color non-LED was later created in 1972?
What graduate student of Holonyak created the yellow non-LED?

context: The first visible-spectrum (<a2_0><b7_0>red<b7_0/><a2_0/>) LED was developed in 1962 by <a1_0><b6_0>Nick Holonyak, Jr.<b6_0/><a1_0/>, while working at <a0_0><b5_0>General Electric Company<b5_0/><a0_0/>. Holonyak first reported his LED in the journal Applied Physics Letters on the December 1, 1962. <a4_0><b9_0>M. George Craford<b9_0/><a4_0/>, a former graduate student of Holonyak, invented the first <a3_0><b8_0>yellow<b8_0/><a3_0/> LED and improved the brightness of red and red-orange LEDs by a factor of ten in 1972. In 1976, T. P. Pearsall created the first high-brightness, high-efficiency LEDs for optical fiber telecommunications by inventing new semiconductor materials specifically adapted to optical fiber transmission wavelengths.
